Description: Body fragment from an Attic black-figured pottery Panathenaic amphora. Athena striding to right; part of the garment remains; added white dots edging the kolpos. Incision for exterior contour as well as for interior details.
Curator's comments: Object owned and held by the Greco-Roman Museum, Alexandria. This record is included in the British Museum database as part of the Museum’s Naukratis Project, a research collaboration that aims to virtually re-unite finds from the ancient port city of Naukratis, now distributed over 80 museums worldwide.
The piece has close, but not striking, ressemblance to Athenas on mid-4th century BC Panathenaic prize amphorae. See M. Bentz, Panathenaische Preisamphoren (Basel 1998) 186, 4.224.
Bibliographic references: Venit 1988 / Greek Painted Pottery from Naukratis in Egyptian Museums (p. 53 no. 181 pl. 42)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GA.2068)
